before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"4gl1b","text":"Ensure adequate volumes of Sera-Mag™ Speedbead solution have been prepared prior to initiating the protocol, 500 μL is required per sample (recipe below).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2i6q8","text":"This requires 50% PEG 8000, 10% Tween-20, SpeedBead wash suspension and SpeedBead binding solution to be prepared prior to initiating the protocol.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

creator.name: Tree of Life Genome Note Editor

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"fhi57","text":"The Plant Organic HMW gDNA Extraction (POE) protocol acts as the Tree of Life's mid-throughput, reserve gDNA extraction procedure for recalcitrant, ‘routine failure’ species within the Plantae kingdom. Developed in-house, it is highly efficient at isolating pure, high-quality and high molecular weight (HMW) gDNA from the majority of plant species to an extent adequate for long-read sequencing.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8m5i2","text":"The POE protocol is divided into four stages: direct tissue lysis with an SDS-based buffer containing reducing agents to mitigate oxidative DNA damage, centrifugation and DS-protein complex precipitation using potassium acetate, gDNA isolation by two chloroform phase separations, and gDNA capture/purification using a 1X Sera-Mag™ SpeedBead and 0.45X AMPure® PB double SPRI cleanup/size selection. The protocol generally yields a sufficient quantity of high purity, ultra HMW (uHMW; 100 kb+) gDNA from 65–100 mg of fresh-frozen tissue for high-quality long-read sequencing submissions. However, outcome success is dependent on the plant species, tissue type and sample quality.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aiah8","text":"The output of this protocol is uHMW gDNA, which depending upon yield and genome size of the species, can be directed towards either HMW DNA Pooling, HMW DNA Fragmentation: Diagenode Megaruptor®3 for LI PacBio or HMW DNA Fragmentation: g-Tube for ULI PacBio.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8jb2t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"42d21","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bnp9g","text":"Acronyms","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"58kee","text":"HMW: high molecular weight","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4ulam","text":"gDNA: genomic DNA","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1jqk7","text":"SPRI: solid-phase reversible immobilisation","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3fu74","text":"LI: low input","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ngo4","text":"ULI: ultra-low input","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

groups.title: Tree of Life at the Wellcome Sanger Institute

guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"8aou8","text":"High-grade, young leaf material with no observable damage, disease or other stressors, which generally have less contaminant accumulation and are most pliable, should be preferentially selected for optimal outcomes downstream.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8dhgl","text":"Alternative pliable tissue types (e.g. herbaceous stem, petiole or flower) may be selected if required, however outcomes may vary.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"jatu","text":"Recalcitrant sample types (e.g. woody or rigid, fibrous tissues) or tissues with signs of stress should be avoided where possible.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2146n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5dnbb","text":"Plant tissues should be preserved via flash freezing and stored under constant cryogenic conditions thereafter (e.g. within a –80 °C freezer). Alternative preservation techniques can be performed but outcomes may vary.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ehs0","text":"Whole-frozen or disrupted plant tissues can be stored long term at –80 °C with minimal detrimental effects observed.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9mbod","text":"Premature thawing of material or repeat freeze-thaw cycles can drastically decrease extraction efficiency due to gDNA degradation.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9hgn1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"24r","text":"Ensure plant tissue is completely disrupted into a fine powder; avoid matted/clumped powder or fibrous material.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":23,"length":39}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bi1d","text":"Complete disruption is crucial to ensure optimal DNA yield and integrity; poorly disrupted input material can drastically decrease extraction efficiency and all quantifiable outcomes.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"55md6","text":"Plant tissues can be disrupted via cryogenic grinding (mortar and pestle), with the CP02 cryoPREP Automated Dry Pulverizer, or by cryogenic bead beating – it is recommended to follow the standardised steps outlined in the Sanger Tree of Life Sample Homogenisation: Covaris cryoPREP® Automated Dry Pulverizer and Sanger Tree of Life Sample Homogenisation: Cryogenic Bead Beating of Plants with FastPrep-96 protocols.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"elo17","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cjg9j","text":"An experienced operator can expect to comfortably process up to 24 samples per session, with 2–3 hours of handling time required over a start to finish period of 4–6 hours. This estimation excludes the overnight incubation of eluates to solubilise gDNA, subsequent QC checks, and includes the utilisation of the KingFisher™ Apex Instrument to perform the double SPRI cleanup/size selection – alternatively, this can be performed manually.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e7udk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e9od6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fpod1","text":"Additional Notes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5cg2a","text":"It is recommended to split larger numbers of samples (12+) into 2 batches, starting step 8 on the second batch once the first is almost ready to come off the tube rotator (step 8.2).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"emm4a","text":"Tri-coded FluidX tube are used throughout the Tree of Life programme in order to track samples, therefore all routine DNA extracts are stored in FluidX tubes.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fv602","text":"Both the KingFisher™ Apex protocol script and the KFX.file have been made available for this protocol – the KFX.file requires ‘BindIx software for KingFisher Apex’ to allow the KingFisher™ Apex protocol to be viewed on a PC or laptop. Alternatively, the file can be transferred directly onto a KingFisher™ Apex instrument using a USB.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5e1ts","text":"Whilst highly effective at isolating gDNA from endogenous contaminants, this protocol is generally unsuitable for species with exceptionally high polysaccharide concentrations that form viscous lysates. For these, an alternative HMW gDNA extraction protocol should be performed.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: Plant extraction,DNA extraction,HMW DNA extraction,organic extraction,high molecular weight,next generation sequencing,third generation sequencing,long read sequencing

protocol_references: {"blocks":[{"key":"1f41e","text":"Mayjonade, B. et al. (2016) ‘Extraction of high-molecular-weight genomic DNA for long-read sequencing of single molecules’, BioTechniques, 61(4), pp. 203–205. doi:10.2144/000114460.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3eoa","text":"Prepare an adequate volume of the ‘Direct Plant Lysis Buffer’ (recipe in Materials).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"align-justify","offset":0,"length":84}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fno9o","text":"Preheat the direct plant lysis buffer for 15–30 mins, 65 °C at 400 rpm prior to use, ensuring the total dissolution of reagents.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"acj10","text":"Add DTT and Proteinase K to the direct plant lysis buffer immediately prior to use, ensuring both reagents are thoroughly mixed.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"align-justify","offset":0,"length":128}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4433n","text":"Aliquot 65–100 mg of cryogenically disrupted tissue samples into individual 2 mL Lo-Bind tubes on dry ice.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a9dbc","text":"Transfer 2 mL Lo-Bind tubes containing sample to wet ice for 10–15 minutes, allowing sample temperature to equilibrate.","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"5od2s","text":"Perform the direct sample lysis.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f4nj6","text":"Add 550 μL of preheated direct plant lysis buffer (65 °C) to the first sample, immediately pulse vortex 5 times at full speed and place on a heat block at 55 °C, 600 rpm. Repeat for each sample.","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1m8l3","text":"Once all samples are homogenised and have began incubation, inspect each by inverting to mix. Any samples with aggregated tissue that can’t be homogenised through inversion should be mixed with wide bore p1000 until homogenous.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"atqag","text":"After 15 minutes of incubation, add 4 µL RNase A to each sample and mix by inversion until any aggregated, insoluble or sedimented tissue particles are resuspended. Repeat step 4.2 for severely reaggregated samples.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"align-justify","offset":0,"length":215}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"34p1d","text":"The 4 µL RNase A can be diluted in 6 µL PBS per sample and added to the sample with a Multipette to improve ergonomics.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"align-justify","offset":0,"length":119}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fp467","text":"Incubate for another 45 minutes, 55 °C at 600 rpm.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"align-justify","offset":0,"length":50}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6op54","text":"Do not agitate by mixing for the last 15 minutes of lysis; allow any unlysed sediment to settle at the bottom of the tube.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"align-justify","offset":0,"length":122}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8583e","text":"Whilst the samples are incubating, prepare fresh 2 mL Lobind tubes containing 150 μL of cold potassium acetate (4 °C; 5 M; pH 7.4) for each sample, and place on wet ice.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d8gua","text":"Remove the samples from the heat block, allow the lysate to settle for 5 mins at RT, and centrifuge for 10 minutes, 8,000 rpm at room temperature.","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4p3am","text":"Avoid disturbing the settled insoluble tissue prior to centrifugation.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"align-justify","offset":0,"length":70}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ea8e9","text":"Use a wide bore p1000 to transfer the supernatant to its corresponding 2 mL Lo-Bind tubes containing 150 μL cold potassium acetate (4 °C; 5 M; pH 7.4), and carefully mix by pipetting with the same wide bore until homogenous.","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d0sfj","text":"gDNA is highly susceptible from this point; handle samples with care.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"align-justify","offset":0,"length":69}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"183j4","text":"The precipitate should appear whitish, opaque and slightly viscous.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"align-justify","offset":0,"length":67}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"nng6","text":"Incubate the samples on wet ice for 5 minutes (precipitated samples can be left on wet ice for up to an hour if a break is required).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"20i59","text":"500 μL of Sera-Mag™ Speedbead solution and 175 μL of AMPure® PB beads per sample should now be removed from the fridge to equilibrate to room temperature.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"60g5l","text":"A tabletop centrifuge should now be pre-chilled to 4 °C.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"90v6l","text":"Perform the first chloroform separation (C:IA) in the fume hood:","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6nhk3","text":"Add 700 μL cold chloroform:isoamyl alcohol (–20 °C; 24:1, v/v) to the samples.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"acnmv","text":"Mix on a tube rotator at 25 rpm for 10 minutes.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"d327e","text":"Centrifuge at 13,000 rpm for 5 minutes at 4 °C.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"46r67","text":"Transfer up to 700 μL of the aqueous phase (top layer) to a fresh 2 mL Lo-Bind tube using a wide bore p1000.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"align-justify","offset":0,"length":108}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e3ren","text":"Carefully aspirate from the top of the aqueous phase to avoid ’dragging’ contaminants from the interphase into the pipette.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"align-justify","offset":0,"length":123}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9bk1q","text":"Perform the second chloroform separation (C:IA) in the fume hood:","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"csj2g","text":"Add 700 μL cold chloroform:isoamyl alcohol (–20 °C; 24:1, v/v) to the sample.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"5m8gh","text":"Mix on a tube rotator at 25 rpm for 10 minutes.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8n2qm","text":"Centrifuge at 13,000 rpm for 5 minutes at 4 °C.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1c57p","text":"Transfer up to 600 μL of the aqueous phase (top layer) to the applicable empty well of the ‘Sample Plate’ (See step 12) using a wide bore p1000.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"align-justify","offset":0,"length":144}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5uf5d","text":"Carefully aspirate from the top of the aqueous phase to avoid ’dragging’ contaminants from the interphase into the pipette.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"align-justify","offset":0,"length":123}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eevq","text":"Add 500 µL Sera-Mag™ SpeedBead solution to the well containing the sample of the ‘POE Sample Plate’.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3q622","text":"Label seven KingFisher™ 1 mL 96-well Deep-well plates and one KingFisher™ 200 µL standard 96-well plate with the following labels, and fill all applicable wells of each plate with their corresponding reagents (see table below).","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6taos","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9810h","text":"   Plate namePlate TypeReagent(s) requiredPOE Tip plate 11 mL96-well tip comb (no reagent)POE Sample plate1 mLUp to 600 μL aqueous phase of sample + 500 μL Sera-Mag™ Speedbead solutionPOE Ethanol wash 1.11 mL1 mL 80% ETOHPOE Ethanol wash 1.21 mL1 mL 80% ETOHPOE Elution Plate 11 mL400 µL Buffer EBPOE Tip plate 21 mL96-well tip comb (no reagent)POE Ethanol wash 21 mL1 mL 80% ETOHPOE Elution Plate 2200 µL135 µL Buffer {"blocks":[{"key":"cdv7k","text":"Select the required DNA extraction protocol in the protocol list on the KingFisher™ Apex (details in KingFisher™ Apex POE Protocol Script/attached KFX file in the Materials section) and select using the play button.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"clqau","text":"Load the filled plates onto the instrument following the instructions provided on screen and initiate once ready.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"37f5u","text":"The instrument will prompt once the 1X SpeedBead SPRI is finished: add 175 µL (0.45X) AMPure PB beads to each well containing sample of the ‘POE Elution Plate 1’, place the plate back into the instrument, and continue the run.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3ktf9","text":"The instrument will prompt when the 0.45X AMPure PB SPRI is finished: remove the ‘POE Elution Plate 2’ and use a wide bore p200 to transfer the 135 µL sample eluate to an appropriate tube for gDNA storage.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"qiob","text":"Incubate the sample at RT overnight to allow the gDNA to solubilise.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"dcls4","text":"Proceed to appropriate QC checks and downstream processing.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7e9i4","text":"Store the DNA at 4 °C.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"8el2k","text":"Powder-free nitrile gloves, eye protection and a lab coat should be worn by the operator when performing this procedure.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9h1it","text":"Glove liners are strongly recommended when handling cryogenic substances.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"at5up","text":"Eye protection and silver shield/chemical resistant gloves should be worn when handling chloroform, with all handling performed in a chemical fume hood.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bgmk7","text":"Waste needs to be collected in a suitable container (e.g. plastic screw-top jar or Biobin) and disposed of in accordance with local regulations.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3me0q","text":"Liquid waste needs to be collected in a suitable container (e.g. glass screw-top jar) and disposed of in accordance with local regulations.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
